DataElement.preferredName: Participant Consent Future Lung Carcinoma Research Activity Blood And Tissue Storage Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A yes or no response to indicate whether the participant give permissions for their blood and tissue samples to be kept for use in future Lung Cancer research.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Participant Consent Future Lung Carcinoma Research Activity Blood And Tissue Storage
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Someone who takes part in an activity._Permission to do something._A time that is yet to come._A carcinoma originating in the lung. Lung carcinomas usually arise from the epithelium that lines the bronchial tree (bronchogenic carcinomas), and are classified as small cell or non-small cell carcinomas. Non-small cell lung carcinomas are usually adenocarcinomas, squamous cell carcinomas, or large cell carcinomas. Metastatic carcinomas to the lung are also common, and can be difficult to distinguish from primary tumors._Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, establish or revise a theory, or develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered._A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function._The act of safekeeping goods in a depository.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Someone who takes part in an activity.:Permission to do something.

Concepts.definition: Someone who takes part in an activity.

Property.preferredName: Future Lung Carcinoma Research Activity Blood And Tissue Storage
Property.preferredDefinition: A time that is yet to come.:A carcinoma originating in the lung. Lung carcinomas usually arise from the epithelium that lines the bronchial tree (bronchogenic carcinomas), and are classified as small cell or non-small cell carcinomas. Non-small cell lung carcinomas are usually adenocarcinomas, squamous cell carcinomas, or large cell carcinomas. Metastatic carcinomas to the lung are also common, and can be difficult to distinguish from primary tumors.:Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, establish or revise a theory, or develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered.:A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.:The act of safekeeping goods in a depository.

Concepts.definition: A time that is yet to come.

A carcinoma originating in the lung. Lung carcinomas usually arise from the epithelium that lines the bronchial tree (bronchogenic carcinomas), and are classified as small cell or non-small cell carcinomas. Non-small cell lung carcinomas are usually adenocarcinomas, squamous cell carcinomas, or large cell carcinomas. Metastatic carcinomas to the lung are also common, and can be difficult to distinguish from primary tumors.
Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, establish or revise a theory, or develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered.

A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.
The act of safekeeping goods in a depository.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the participant give the
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the participant give their permissions for their sputum, blood, urine, and tissue samples to be kept for use in future research to learn more about how to prevent, detect, or treat Lung Cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the participant give their permissions for their sputum, blood, urine, and tissue samples to be kept by Dr. York Miller for use in future research to learn more about how to prevent, detect, or treat Lung Cancer?
